<doc> Outer Windows

== Description ==

HOP windows are window managed by the client window manager. They can only
entire documents.

== Synopsis ==

=== Client ===

  (window-open arg ...)
  (window-close win)

=== Requirements ===

Documents using //windows// need to load the script
++hop-iwindow.js++.  They also might want to load the
++hop-iwindow.css++ style sheet. Hence, documents using //windows//
must include in their header, the following statement:


  (<HEAD> :include "hop-window")


== Examples ==

<example>window</example>

== Client Definitions ==
<client>

=== ++(window-open o [t] [attr] [w h] [x y])++ ===
<procedure> window-open

<arguments>
^  arguments  ^   type    ^   description                                   ^
| o           |   obj     | the content material.                           |
| t           |  string   | an optional title, defaults to ++id++.          |
| attr        |  string   | an optional attribute.                          |
| w           |  integer  | the optional width.                             |
| h           |  integer  | the optional height.                            |
| x           |  integer  | the optional X coordinate.                      |
| y           |  integer  | the optional Y coordinate.                      |
</arguments>


</procedure>

=== ++(window-close obj)++ ===
<procedure> window-close

<arguments>
^  arguments  ^   type    ^   description                                   ^
| obj         |   obj     | A window identifier or a window itself.         |
</arguments>

~~
This client-side procedure closes an //window//.

</procedure>
<client>
